page.title: 04SEA DEFENCES
page.content: My name is Graham Raven and I have lived in Overy Staithe all my life - some thirty years. As a boy I played in the Creek and marshes getting to know every stream, every mudbank and every feature of the area. I became interested in shooting and fishing and never missed the opportunity to go to sea in a boat. While I grew so did the danger of the sea and it became obvious that sooner or later winter high tides would break the banks and flood the area with disastrous results. Fortunately the Manpower Services Commission was asked to help out and I became involved with a strong team of local men who were paid to bolster the defence against the sea. The work has lasted for two years and we have achieved a great deal. We hope the defences are secure for many years.
